description.narrative: The project was officially launched on 22 November 2019 during a signing ceremony attended by theAmbassador of the Kingdom of the Netherlands to Jordan, His Royal Highness Prince Mired Bin Raad, President of the Higher Council for the Rights of Persons with Disabilities, Executive Director of the King Hussein Foundation and relevant partners and stakeholder .Media Coverage annexed -Establishment of a project management Unit: February 2020- Completed The unit located at the King Hussein led by the project manager comprising of an M& E specialist, a Media and Communication Specialist, a Finance Director, and a Procurement and logistics Unit Head responsible for providing a framework utilizing project management policies and processes to support a team of 10 technical and administrative staff in addition to a group of experts in research, case management, and psychosocial therapy as well as maintain the processes, procedures and mechanisms to enable the operation of the project and achieve overall objective, output and outcomesTemplates Annexed -Orientation session for PMU and partner organizations :March 2020 -completed The session was organized to introduce the project’s goals, objective, activities, outputs and outcome. -Production of Publicity material: March – May 2020- Completed Designed a logo for the project to be used in all communication and printed material,Set up social media accounts : Facebook , YouTube, Instagram and twitter account, Designed a roll up, Designed and printed a Leaflet with infographs to give an overview of the project to the different stake holders and general public (printed and shared via social media). Printed material annexed

activity-date.narrative: The signing of the contract was dated 1 November and the official launch with visibility was organized on 22 November 2019
